block.p: DEBT * GE Capital Corp., a unit of General Electric Co., filed a shelf registration for up to $3 billion of variable-denomination floating-rate notes. COMMON STOCK
DEBT * GE Capital Corp., a unit of General Electric Co., filed a shelf registration for up to $3 billion of variable-denomination floating-rate notes. COMMON STOCK

* Wabash National Corp., Lafayette, Ind., filed for an initial public offering of 2.4 million common shares through Alex. Brown & Sons. Wabash makes truck tailers, refrigerated vans and other transportation equipment. RATINGS * Detroit Economic Development Corp.'s two series of resource-recovery revenue bonds totaling $166.4 million were assigned a B+ rating by S.& P. The ratings agency said that once the city received expected insurance coverage for the bonds from the Financial Security Association, it would raise the bonds' rating to AAA. * St. Louis Water Co.'s $110 million in privately placed first-mortgage bonds received an A rating from S.& P. * Maxxam Group's $100 million in proposed senior secured notes, due in 1995, have been rated B- by S.& P. The Los Angeles-based company has interests in forest products and aluminum.
